greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = first of exactly n consecutive integers that each divide A181063(n).
comment: a(n)=1 iff n belongs to A181062.
link: David W. Wilson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: The discrete string of 5 consecutive integers that divide A181063(5)=3960 begins with 8 and ends with 12; hence a(5)=8.
results.author: _Matthew Vandermast_, Oct 07 2010
